visualization_prompt: Generate three small multiples (column, line, bar charts) showing synthetic monthly trends and product category performance using Highcharts with external tooltips and ≥10 data points per series
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three distinct visualizations: 1) A 12-month time series (μ=158, σ=32) showing regional sales trends with +18% YoY growth 2) A growth index series demonstrating exponential progression (R²=0.98 fit) 3) Categorical market share data across 10 product categories with 2022-2023 comparisons. Synthetic data maintains domain validity through constrained value ranges (sales: 90-240 units, market share: 3-22%) and temporal patterns (summer seasonality in sales, Q4 holiday spikes). The column/line charts use Date.UTC timestamps for precise temporal encoding, while the bar chart employs ordinal positioning for categorical comparison. Chart designs follow Tufte's data-ink principles by minimizing gridlines and using high-contrast colors (ΔE > 500) for categorical discrimination. Tooltip implementation adheres to Cairo's active comparison guidance by maintaining persistent visual anchors during interaction.
